subject: Investing
title: Emerging Market Bonds
description: A short lesson to help you apply Emerging Market Bonds.

hook.text: Brazilian government bonds yielded 12% when US Treasuries offered 4%. The extra return comes with extra risk.

buildup.text: Emerging market bonds come in two flavors: hard currency (USD-denominated) and local currency.

discovery.text: Hard-currency bonds avoid FX risk but pay lower yields. Local-currency bonds offer higher yields plus currency exposure.

twist.text: Sovereign defaultsâ€”like Argentina's nine defaultsâ€”show that higher yields compensate for real repayment risk.

climax.text: EM bond ETFs diversify across dozens of countries, reducing the impact of any single default.

punchline.text: Emerging market bonds pay you for risk. Make sure the pay is worth the ride.

quiz.question: What is the difference between hard-currency and local-currency EM bonds?
options: Hard-currency bonds are in USD; local-currency bonds carry FX risk
